headline.main: MARGARITA RIVAS ENGAGED TO WED; Daughter of Acting Counsul of Uruguay Will be Bride of Frederick H. Miller Jr.

docs.snippet: Tomorrow, the birthday of George Washington, pastors will preach sermons paying tribute to him in the light of the present war. One clergyman will discuss "If Washington Were Alive Today," another "Our Valley Forge," and another "If Washington Were...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tomorrow, the birthday of George Washington, pastors will preach sermons paying tribute to him in the light of the present war. One clergyman will discuss "If Washington Were Alive Today," another "Our Valley Forge," and another "If Washington Were Here Today."

headline.main: Topics of Sermons That Will Be Heard in the Churches of the City Tomorrow; TOPICS OF SERMONS IN CITY TOMORROW

docs.snippet: IT probably would take a full-grown genius to say anything new on the Latin-American world, so Mr. Schurz has limited his aims to a clear, concise and freshly informative rearrangement of the available material. Having lived for many years in South...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT probably would take a full-grown genius to say anything new on the Latin-American world, so Mr. Schurz has limited his aims to a clear, concise and freshly informative rearrangement of the available material. Having lived for many years in South America and the countries bordering the Caribbean, he is able to give a first-hand account of the land, its people, government, economy and international relations.

headline.main: An Illuminating Survey of Latin-American Republics; LATIN AMERICA. A Descriptive Survey. By William Lytle Schurz. 378 pp. New York: E.P. Dutton & Co. $3.75.

docs.snippet: In keeping with the spirit of the Good Neighbor policy, a record number of South American scholars and students are studying in American educational institutions this year. As never before, a powerful cultural program has been established that is...
docs.lead_paragraph: In keeping with the spirit of the Good Neighbor policy, a record number of South American scholars and students are studying in American educational institutions this year. As never before, a powerful cultural program has been established that is expected to draw the people of both continents closer together.

headline.main: Latin America Sets Record in Students Here; Good Neighbor Policy Jumps Number From 1,400 to 2,400 in Year

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 21 -- President Alfredo Baldomir dissolved Congress at 5 o'clock this morning and sent troops to all strategic points in Montevideo.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 21 -- President Alfredo Baldomir dissolved Congress at 5 o'clock this morning and sent troops to all strategic points in Montevideo.
docs.abstract: Pres Baldomir dissolves Cong following censure vote by Sen L A de Herrera and followers; Cabinet resigns to give Baldomir free hand; War Min J A Roletti temporarily replaced by Foreign Min Guani; Vice Pres C Charlone por

headline.main: ANTI-U.S. MOVES FOILED IN URUGUAY; Baldomir Dissolves Congress Because of Opposition of Group in the Senate PROPONENTS IN ATTEMPTED URUGUAY COUP ANTI-U.S. MOVES FOILED IN URUGUAY

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Latin America's foreign trade, which by the declaration of the Rio Conference and other official statements of policy the United States has undertaken to promote, will be seriously hampered if the New York Foreign Trade Zone and its facilities are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin America's foreign trade, which by the declaration of the Rio Conference and other official statements of policy the United States has undertaken to promote, will be seriously hampered if the New York Foreign Trade Zone and its facilities are discontinued, the new York Customs Brokers Association declared yesterday.

headline.main: TRADE ZONE'S END HELD DISASTROUS; Custom Brokers Warn Blow to Latin Commerce Could Offset Gains at Rio TRADE ZONE'S END HELD DIDASASTROUS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Feb. 21 (U.P.) -- President Alfredo Baldomir, who today crushed a revolt against his strongly anti-Axis government and dissolved Congress, told the nation tonight that he acted only "when convinced that otherwise the republic would fall...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Feb. 21 (U.P.) -- President Alfredo Baldomir, who today crushed a revolt against his strongly anti-Axis government and dissolved Congress, told the nation tonight that he acted only "when convinced that otherwise the republic would fall into * * * anarchy."

docs.snippet: Reflecting the modest turnover and the unimportant fluctuations reported, interest in the foreign exchange market last week was at a low ebb. Those two currencies which had been furnishing the only worth-while movements of consequence since the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Reflecting the modest turnover and the unimportant fluctuations reported, interest in the foreign exchange market last week was at a low ebb. Those two currencies which had been furnishing the only worth-while movements of consequence since the beginning of the year -- the Canadian and Cuban -- were finally tied in with the other currencies to close at a fractional loss in the Dominion currency, and unchanged for the Cuban.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED FEB. 21, 1942

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 22 -- Much disappointment and some apprehension became evident, not only in commercial but also in government circles, by the announcement today that the Moore-McCormack Line of passenger steamers to Brazil and Uruguay...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Feb. 22 -- Much disappointment and some apprehension became evident, not only in commercial but also in government circles, by the announcement today that the Moore-McCormack Line of passenger steamers to Brazil and Uruguay had been taken off the South American run, having been requisitioned by the United States Government.

headline.main: U.S. SHIP WITHDRAWAL WORRIES ARGENTINA; Moore-McCormack Cancellation Adds to River Plate Shortage
